events.description: Release of inflation data showing headline inflation at 1.7% and core inflation at 2.2%.
The upcoming interest rate decision by the European Central Bank scheduled for Thursday.

facts.fact_text: Eurozone headline inflation eased to 1.7% year-on-year.

evidences.evidence_text: EUROSTAT figures showed headline inflation eased to 1.7% year-on-year, in line with expectations and the lowest since September 2024

facts.fact_text: Core inflation fell to 2.2%, which is its lowest level since October 2021.

evidences.evidence_text: core inflation fell to 2.2%, slightly below forecasts and its lowest since October 2021.

facts.fact_text: The euro held near $1.18, remaining below its recent four-year high.

evidences.evidence_text: The euro held near $1.18, below last week’s more than four-year high of $1.20

facts.fact_text: The ECB has not changed its policy since June.

evidences.evidence_text: The central bank has held policy steady since June

claims.claim_text: Markets expect the ECB to maintain current interest rates.
claims.author: Markets

evidences.evidence_text: Markets widely expect the ECB to keep interest rates unchanged

claims.claim_text: Further strengthening of the euro could lead to the resumption of rate cuts.
claims.author: some officials

evidences.evidence_text: some warned that further euro strength could prompt a resumption of rate cuts.

claims.claim_text: The current policy stance is considered to be in a good place.
claims.author: officials

evidences.evidence_text: officials describing it as being in a “good place”

evidence.evidence_text: some warned that further euro strength could prompt a resumption of rate cuts.
policymakers weigh the impact of a stronger euro and low-priced Chinese imports on the inflation outlook.
investors digested January’s Eurozone CPI data ahead of Thursday’s ECB policy decision.
